questions.question_text:
You have a Teams Phone deployment that contains offices in Brisbane and Melbourne.

You deploy a new Session Border Controller (SBC) named SBC2 to the Brisbane office.

You need to ensure that emergency calls from only the users in the Brisbane office use SBC2.

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AF
it should be A and F.

comments.content:
I agree! although Emergency Policy can be assigned to DR users as well, in this context the emergency calling will have to handled by Routing Policy either at the Network Site Level or at the individual user level or both. In any case the Routing policy should kick in and trump Emergency Policy.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/considerations-direct-routing#:~:text=Direct%20Routing.-,Emergency%20call%20enablement%20for%20Direct%20Routing,-For%20Direct%20Routing

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AF
A: This policy will define the routing rules for emergency calls to ensure they are directed through SBC2.
F: This ensures that the users in the Brisbane office follow the specified routing rules for emergency calls.

Assign Users to SBC2: In the Teams admin center, navigate to Voice > Direct Routing. Select SBC2 and assign the users in the Brisbane office to this SBC. This ensures that their calls are routed through SBC2.
Configure Emergency Call Routing Policy: Create a new emergency call routing policy in the Teams admin center under Voice > Emergency policies > Emergency call routing policies. In this policy, specify SBC2 as the session border controller for emergency calls. Then, assign this policy to the users in the Brisbane office

Although I agree with VSARAVAN and GaryMegian about the dynamic emergency calling in the emergency call routing policy, there's no mention of staff moving between offices. If this is a static environment, the answer posted (D & E) is correct.

choices.A: Create a new emergency call routing policy.
choices.D: Create a new emergency calling policy.
choices.E: Assign an emergency calling policy to the Brisbane office users.
choices.F: Assign an emergency call routing policy to the Brisbane office users.
choices.C: Assign a dial plan to the Brisbane office users.

choices.A: From Microsoft Call Quality Dashboard, download the current Tenant Data Upload file.
choices.D: Install the Microsoft Power Platform connector.
choices.C: Install the Power BI Connector for CQD.
choices.B: Publish the template to the Power BI service.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

"Before you can use the Power BI query templates (PBIX files) for Microsoft Teams Call Quality Dashboard (CQD), you'll need to install the Microsoft Call Quality connector for Power BI, using the MicrosoftCallQuality.pqx"

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/cqd-power-bi-connector

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment that uses Direct Routing.
You plan to use Microsoft Power BI to analyze Call Quality Dashboard (CQD) data for the deployment.
You download the Power BI query templates for CQD from the Microsoft Download Center.
You need to use Power BI Desktop to review reports about PSTN calls that go through Direct Routing.
What should you do first?

discussion.content:
A. From the Microsoft Teams admin center, select Voice, select Dial plan, and then select Add.

To create a new tenant dial plan that meets the unique dialing requirements of a new country, you need to add a new dial plan specifically for that country. In Microsoft Teams, dial plans are used to normalize phone numbers to ensure they are in the correct format for calling.

choices.C: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, select Voice select Calling policies and then select Add.
choices.B: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, select Voice select Phone numbers, and then select Add.
choices.A: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, select Voice select Dial plan, and then select Add.
choices.D: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, select Locations, select Network topology, and then select Add.

questions.question_text:
Your company has offices in 10 countries. The company has a tenant dial plan configured for each country.

The company recently opened an office in a new country.

You need to create a new tenant dial plan that meets the unique dialing requirements of the new country.

What should you do?

discussion.content: when a caller calls on 1/18/2023, the call will be directed automatically to T-AA is NO. it will NOT be automatic and require option 1 to be pressed

comments.content: Agreeing with VSARAVAN. You have to press 1 - you won't be directed automatically.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment that uses Teams Calling Plans, Direct Routing, and Operator Connect services.

You need to enable PSTN services for 100 new users. The solution must minimize administrative effort.

Which cmdlet should you run?
